front.title: Requirements for a next generation Internet Time Protocol

abstract.t: Providing timing services over an IP network, known as wall-clock,has traditionally been done with the Network Time Protocol, NTP. Thecurrent version of NTP, version 4, has been in existence for a longtime, but only recently been adopted as an IETF Standard. In themean time however, the requirements for higher precision of wall-clock services over IP networks has grown. This document outlinessome of the requirements of wall-clock services that is not providedby NTPv4, and is intended to serve as a gap analysis.
